metadata.purpose: Enriched pipeline prospects with full context for sales follow-up

HOT.name: Scott Barney

context.background: Solo practitioner with litigation paralegal. 15+ years experience. Excellent reputation as litigator. Majority of cases settle out of court.
context.current_state: Had 131 cases during COVID, now down to 30-35. Signing 3-5 cases/month. Desperate for consistent lead flow.
context.what_hasnt_worked: Everything except Meta campaigns. Never tried Facebook/Instagram campaigns.

pain_points: Quarter million dollars wasted on marketing that didn't deliver
Only 30-35 active cases (was 131 during COVID)
Sales pitches never pan out as promised
Can't afford TV/billboards
Needs trusted long-term partner
May not be saying right things on intake (self-doubt)
In litigation fight with Florida referral partner (stressed)
HOT.budget: $15,000 minimum (willing to go higher for results)
HOT.timeline: URGENT - scheduled Patrick call next day at 2:30 PM
what_resonated: Patrick as dedicated intake person (former intake director)
Different from other lead gen firms
Doesn't have to do calling himself
Cost per case around $2,000 in Virginia
3-5X ROI on first batch, potentially 10-15X long term
quotes: I have probably spent quarter million dollars on wasted marketing
I'm just pulling my hair out at my wit's end
I'm not a marketing expert. I'm a personal injury expert
I don't have the time to do what he's doing
It's nice to speak to somebody who's a professional
HOT.recommended_next_action: FOLLOW UP IMMEDIATELY on Patrick call outcome. He was scheduled with Patrick at 2:30 PM. Desperate buyer - high close probability if Patrick delivers confidence.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: Needs actual results, not more promises. Burned veteran mindset.

HOT.name: Ross Robin
HOT.location: Houston, Texas (lives there) - Licensed in Texas, Arizona, Colorado, Florida

context.background: 15 years as mass tort lawyer with significant success. Setting up NEW personal injury firm - separate entity, separate brand. Has intake team experience from mass tort.
context.current_state: Starting PI firm from scratch. Zero PI lead gen yet. Wants Texas to start.
context.what_they_need: Quick lead flow to new PI firm. Focused on Texas initially but licensed in 4 states.

pain_points: Starting from complete scratch with PI
Needs dedicated intake (not using mass tort firm's assets)
Needs new intake team, new managers, new everything
Shopping around with many vendors (booked 'a ton' of calls)
HOT.timeline: READY - Was sent email, asked to review and circle back
what_resonated: Patrick's $350/signup - perfect for firm without intake team
Can start signing cases day one
quotes: I've been a mass tot lawyer for about 15 years and had a lot of success
What I'm doing for this year is setting up a separate entity, totally separate brand
HOT.recommended_next_action: Follow up on email sent. Schedule Patrick call ASAP. Position as 'start signing cases day one' - perfect for new firm without intake team.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: None identified. Decision maker. Ready to start.

HOT.name: Jalal Abdallah
HOT.location: Michigan (licensed), looking to expand to California, New York, Massachusetts

context.background: Family firm with brother (brother licensed in CA). Signing 8-10 MVA cases/month. Aggressively looking to scale coast to coast.
context.current_state: Buying transfers and leads. Everyone in firm trained on intake. Spanish-speaking capabilities important.

pain_points: HATES form fills then chase - 'waste of time'
100 calls for 2 cases is unacceptable
Can't stand the grunt work of intake
Values time over nickels and dimes
HOT.deal_size: Multi-state potential: $50,000+ if expanding to CA
what_resonated: Patrick's expertise - 'knows legal, knows cases, not just a call center'
quotes: I can't stand the, you know, form and then chase 'em... It just a waste of time
For every a hundred people we call, maybe you'll get a couple cases. It's just a waste of time
Looking to expand for sure... coast to coast
HOT.recommended_next_action: Follow up Wednesday as scheduled. Emphasize Patrick's done-for-you intake. Prepare multi-state (MI + CA) proposal for brother's CA license.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: Anything requiring manual follow-up or chasing leads personally

HOT.name: Omeed Hakimianpour

context.background: Already buying leads from agencies - both signed retainers and qualified leads. Has intake team. Looking for additional vendors to scale.
context.current_state: Comparison shopping. Has partner to consult. Interested in SB 37 compliance.

pain_points: SB 37 compliance concerns - new California law
Human error in intake leading to bad signups
Insurance 'drops' after signing - wants credits
Needs performance-based pricing (pay for results)
Wants to minimize risk
HOT.timeline: Mid-next week follow-up. Needs to talk to partner.
what_resonated: Walker Advertising works with Cases on Demand
quotes: How are you guys handling SB 37?
What happens if a lead was qualified but shouldn't have been... insurance drops?
I was looking at, you know, getting help like this, signed cases at the beginning
HOT.recommended_next_action: Send summary email as promised. Connect with Patrick. Address insurance drop credits. Emphasize SB 37 compliance. Follow up mid-next week.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: Vague answers on compliance. Lack of credit system for bad insurance/liability.

HOT.name: Rich Hyde

context.background: Deeply experienced trial lawyer. Only does live transfers or pre-signed retainers. Big in plaintiffs bar, involved with legislative changes in Texas.
context.current_state: Currently paying $2,500 for signed MVAs in Texas. Has multiple vendors. Very skeptical of marketing agencies.

pain_points: Burned by Quintessa (fake leads, bar complaint threat)
Walker advertising 'hot and cold'
Burned by agencies taking high margins
Wants pay-per-lead for control and accountability
Hates 'tough conversations down the road'
Needs contractual guarantees
HOT.budget: $15,000-$30,000 (has 'shit ton of capital' once trust earned)
HOT.timeline: Ready - agreed to receive proposal with guarantees
what_resonated: Patrick's former director of intake background
Willingness to offer guaranteed minimum case costs
quotes: I've heard the same pitch time and time again. I don't know you from Adam
I like per lead because I'm able to pinpoint and there's no tough conversations
Welcome to Texas. It's a competitive market
Those guys we're not gonna house them because Florida decided to go super conservative
HOT.recommended_next_action: Send proposal with GUARANTEED MINIMUMS in writing. Max case cost cap. Credits for bad leads. Patrick intro is critical. Put terms in writing.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: Opaque pricing, no guarantees, 'just trust us' attitude, bar complaint concerns

HOT.name: Dagmawi Getachew

context.background: Solo practitioner. 7 years PI experience. HE IS the intake (solo). Has medical provider network. Transitioning to own practice.
context.current_state: Needs consistent lead flow to feel comfortable about revenue. Tried Case Connect and LegalMap - didn't work.

pain_points: Uncomfortable calling raw leads - solicitation concerns
Case Connect gave opt-in leads he had to call himself
Too general, not specific enough
Many people said 'I never did this' or 'wrong number'
Compliance concern - lawyers can't solicit
Doesn't want to pay for leads where coverage/liability unclear
Wants to limit immediate overhead cost
HOT.deal_size: $17,500 initial, transition to media buy after proof
HOT.timeline: Thinking on it - said will respond in couple days
what_resonated: Patrick's vetting process (coverage, liability, treatment gaps)
Pay-per-lead test = lower risk, then transition to lower cost model
quotes: As lawyers, we can't solicit it. I don't wanna even the impression that I'm the one making the initial contact
The issue is if I don't know the coverage... That's when the cost of lead becomes troublesome
Right now my main focus is limiting the immediate overhead cost
HOT.recommended_next_action: Follow up on pay-per-lead proposal. Emphasize Patrick makes initial contact, NOT him. Address compliance concern directly. Connect with Patrick.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: Being forced to call raw leads personally. High upfront risk with unproven quality.

HOT.name: Lucas Naccarati

context.background: Direct partner at firm. Handles all operations and marketing (100% his capital). Grew previous firm to $5M annually. 120+ clients in less than a year (all referral).
context.current_state: Building platform for long-term scale. Has intake dialed in. Wants predictable marketing system.

pain_points: Referrals are great but not predictable
Wants to mitigate risk with consistent lead flow
Needs to be able to predict and plan financially
New firm (less than a year old)
HOT.timeline: Call cut short (connection issues). Requested proposal.
quotes: I do believe a lot in marketing. Any company I've had... I typically implement the marketing side
If I can mitigate risk and predict stuff that's gonna happen for the company... it helps me with investing, with planning
HOT.recommended_next_action: Send proposal with Patrick CC'd. Emphasize platform building, API integration, and scalability. High-value Fast Scaler - prioritize.
HOT.deal_breaker_watch: None identified. Decision maker with budget.

IN_PROGRESS.name: Daniel Ramirez
IN_PROGRESS.location: Dallas, Texas (20 years) - Expanding to Houston

context.background: Has Dallas office for 20 years. Doing $1M+ in attorney fees annually. ~10 MVA cases/month. Primarily Spanish-speaking clients. Full staff in Dallas.
context.current_state: Just moved to Houston area. Wants to start office there. Needs signed cases initially to minimize Houston staff.

pain_points: Starting new Houston office from scratch
Needs to minimize staff expenses at beginning
Wants signed cases (not leads) initially
Needs Spanish-speaking intake person in Houston
Needs office space before launching
IN_PROGRESS.timeline: 1 week follow-up - Needs office and intake person first
what_resonated: Spanish leads are $100-$150 cheaper per acquisition
Patrick's training goal (eventually transition to internal intake)
Cases on Demand - seen them for a long time
Minimize staff by using signed cases
quotes: I want to start an office here in the Houston area... I want signed cases at the beginning
We do a lot of Spanish speaker cases. That's been our bread and butter
I want to minimize staff expenses at the beginning
Check back with me about a week from this, see where we're at
IN_PROGRESS.recommended_next_action: Follow up in 1 week as agreed. Check on office and intake person progress. Prepare Spanish-focused campaign proposal. Position Patrick's training as path to internal intake.
IN_PROGRESS.deal_breaker_watch: Logistics (office, intake person) - not sales objections

IN_PROGRESS.name: Josh Sweeney
IN_PROGRESS.location: Atlanta, Georgia - Expanding to North Carolina

context.background: 15 different lead sources already. Full intake team. Looking for different channels they're NOT on. Getting duplicates and overlap.
context.current_state: Strong intake team (50 calls before stopping). Higher conversion rates than most clients. Budget increasing monthly/quarterly.

pain_points: Getting duplicates from overlapping vendors
Has 3 Meta vendors already - starting to overlap
Looking for pure play on YouTube or TikTok
Needs geofencing for specific cities (Charlotte overflow)
Doesn't want to be 'test dummy' on new channels
IN_PROGRESS.timeline: Next week follow-up. Leadership meeting to determine budget.
quotes: We have leads coming in from 15 different sources
I'm mostly curious about your non-meta ads... Can somebody make another channel work?
We're starting to get duplicates and overlap
What other channels should we be on?
IN_PROGRESS.recommended_next_action: Provide data on YouTube-only vs Meta conversion rates. Show channel isolation capabilities. Prove non-Meta channel effectiveness before pitch.
IN_PROGRESS.deal_breaker_watch: Overlap with existing vendors. Can't prove YouTube/TikTok-only performance.

IN_PROGRESS.name: Michael Shirts
IN_PROGRESS.location: Las Vegas, Nevada (20+ years in legal community)

context.background: Been in legal community 15-18 years. Primarily referral-based. Tried ONE lead vendor (Law Pronation) - complete failure.
context.current_state: Nothing currently. Law Pronation was waste of time and money. Looking for live transfers with quality.

pain_points: Law Pronation disaster - out of state leads, 6-month-old accidents, no treatment
Rarely got anyone to pick up phone on follow-ups
Insurance companies in Nevada focused on treatment gaps
Vegas saturated with PI firms
Wants treatment within first week ideally (30 days max)
Wants firm branding on ads
IN_PROGRESS.timeline: Scheduled Patrick call for 1:30 PM next day (10:30 AM Pacific)
what_resonated: Patrick's live transfer or signed case service
$30M in pixel data = seasoned, quality leads
$2,000 cost per case with good intake
quotes: Law Pronation was a waste of time and money
Ones that did pick up were out of state or the accident was six months ago without treatment
I'd like to see them at least go to urgent care within the first week
Is there an opportunity to have it branded with our firm name?
IN_PROGRESS.recommended_next_action: Follow up on Patrick call outcome. He was scheduled with Patrick. Emphasize dedicated channels and firm branding. Address Law Pronation trauma with quality assurances.
IN_PROGRESS.deal_breaker_watch: Shared leads, out-of-state leads, old accidents, no treatment verification

IN_PROGRESS.name: Michael Schulz
IN_PROGRESS.notes: Listed as IN PROGRESS but no call transcript or notes found in /home/ec2-user/data/. May need to search CRM or other sources for context.
IN_PROGRESS.recommended_next_action: Search CRM/HubSpot for Michael Schulz contact history. Request call notes from sales team.

IN_PROGRESS.name: Joan Suh
IN_PROGRESS.notes: Listed as IN PROGRESS but no call transcript or notes found in /home/ec2-user/data/. May need to search CRM or other sources for context.
IN_PROGRESS.recommended_next_action: Search CRM/HubSpot for Joan Suh contact history. Request call notes from sales team.

CLOSED.name: Jason E

context.background: Returning client. Worked with Cases on Demand multiple times over 5 years. Got a $2 MILLION case from them previously. Grown tremendously over past 5-7 years.
context.current_state: Ready to restart. 'Mixed bag of results' before but the $2M case 'paid for itself'.

pain_points_addressed: Treatment gap concerns (30 days max agreed)
Lead quality distribution (not shared with bigger firms)
Inconsistent results from past (Patrick solves this)
what_closed_the_deal: Patrick on the call - former intake director credibility
Max's relationship from 5 years of working together
quotes: I did get a $2 million case with you guys. So I paid for myself.
I think we should give it a shot.
I would love to get up and running as soon as possible.
Let's find another four, $5 million deal this time!

criteria_agreed.coverage: Insurance on both sides or uninsured motorist

lessons_learned: Returning clients close FAST when Patrick is on the call
Previous big win ($2M case) creates massive trust

avatar_1_fast_scaler.description: Growing firms with proven intake systems, budget available, understand digital marketing ROI, ready to scale immediately
key_selling_points: Results and scale ($30M ad spend, 8-figure revenue)
Cost per CASE focus (not cost per lead)

avatar_2_burned_veteran.description: Experienced buyers with bad vendor history. Demands contractual protections. Deep skepticism.

avatar_3_solo_transitioner.description: Solo practitioners going independent. Cautious budget. Needs confidence building.

avatar_4_sophisticated_buyer.description: Multi-state firms, comparison shopping, high standards, need differentiation

avatar_5_expansionist.description: Young firms/partners aggressively scaling. Values time over nickels. Wants done-for-you.

key_insights.patrick_is_the_differentiator: In 90%+ of calls, Patrick's background as 'former director of intake' was the #1 trust builder
key_insights.guaranteed_minimums_close_burned_veteran: Offering to put minimum case counts in writing converts skeptical buyers
key_insights.done_for_you_closes_solos: Solo practitioners hate chasing leads - Patrick's service is perfect fit
key_insights.sb37_compliance_critical_for_california: California buyers need verified compliance, disclaimers, 72-hour cure rule
key_insights.spanish_leads_cheaper: Spanish-speaking leads are $100-$150 cheaper per acquisition cost

priority_follow_ups.name: Scott Barney
priority_follow_ups.action: Check Patrick call outcome (was scheduled 2:30 PM). Close immediately if positive.

priority_follow_ups.name: Michael Shirts
priority_follow_ups.action: Check Patrick call outcome (was scheduled 1:30 PM). Address Law Pronation trauma.

priority_follow_ups.name: Lucas Naccarati
priority_follow_ups.action: Send proposal with Patrick CC. High-value Fast Scaler.

priority_follow_ups.name: Ross Robin
priority_follow_ups.action: Follow up on email. Schedule Patrick call.

priority_follow_ups.name: Rich Hyde
priority_follow_ups.action: Send proposal WITH GUARANTEES in writing. Max case cost cap.

priority_follow_ups.name: Jalal Abdallah
priority_follow_ups.action: Follow up Wednesday as scheduled. Prepare CA + MI proposal for brother.

priority_follow_ups.name: Omeed Hakimianpour
priority_follow_ups.action: Send summary email. Connect with Patrick. Follow up mid-next week.

priority_follow_ups.name: Dagmawi Getachew
priority_follow_ups.action: Follow up on pay-per-lead decision. He said 'couple days'.

priority_follow_ups.name: Daniel Ramirez
priority_follow_ups.action: Follow up in 1 week on office/intake person progress.

priority_follow_ups.name: Josh Sweeney
priority_follow_ups.action: Prepare YouTube/TikTok-only channel data. Follow up next week.
